title: Create CLI entry point with citty
description:
Set up the main CLI entry point using citty:

- Create src/cli.ts with citty defineCommand
- Register subcommands: add, init, list
- Set up bin entry in package.json
- Test with `bun run src/cli.ts --help`

Reference: https://github.com/unjs/citty

title: Implement skillbook init command
description:
Implement the `skillbook init` command:

- Scan library for available skills
- Show interactive multi-select checkbox using @clack/prompts
- Ask which tools to configure (Claude Code, Cursor, OpenCode)
- Create symlinks from tool locations to library:
  - Claude Code: .claude/skills/<name>/SKILL.md
  - Cursor: .cursor/rules/<name>.md
  - OpenCode: .opencode/skills/<name>.md
- Print summary of created symlinks

This is the main user-facing command for setting up skills in a project.

title: Project setup: Initialize TypeScript/Bun project
description:
Set up the skillbook project structure:

- Initialize Bun project with `bun init`
- Add dependencies: citty, @clack/prompts, picocolors
- Create src/ directory structure
- Set up package.json scripts
- Create tsconfig.json

Directory structure:
```
src/
├── cli.ts
├── commands/
├── lib/
└── constants.ts
```

title: Create path helpers and constants
description:
Create utility modules for paths and constants:

src/lib/paths.ts:
- getLibraryPath() -> ~/.config/skillbook
- getSkillsPath() -> ~/.config/skillbook/skills
- expandHome() -> expand ~ in paths

src/constants.ts:
- Tool configurations (name, skill path pattern, file naming)
- Supported tools: claude-code, cursor, opencode

These are needed by add, init, and list commands.

title: Implement skillbook list command
description:
Implement the `skillbook list` command:

- Scan ~/.config/skillbook/skills/ directory
- List all skill folders found
- Show skill name (folder name)
- Handle case when library doesn't exist yet

Example output:
```
Available skills:
  - beads
  - typescript
  - review-gitlab
```

title: Implement skillbook add command
description:
Implement the `skillbook add <path>` command:

- Accept path to a skill file (e.g., .claude/skills/beads/SKILL.md)
- Extract skill name from parent folder
- Create ~/.config/skillbook/skills/<name>/ directory
- Copy the skill file to the library
- Print success message

Example:
```bash
skillbook add .claude/skills/beads/SKILL.md
# Added skill 'beads' to library
```
